basic_intent.semantic_description: Add HTTP_REFERER and HTTP_RESPONSE_REDIRECT_LOCATION attributes to existing CLM web application HTTP request spans.

sub_tasks.name: Codebase discovery & ownership confirmation
sub_tasks.description: Search the clm-web solution for existing OpenTelemetry registration, ActivitySource creation, and any custom ASP.NET middleware that already uses Activity/SetTag. Confirm which team owns each file.
sub_tasks.validation_criteria: List of candidate files & owners is posted in ticket comments

sub_tasks.name: Design & decision: enrichment point
sub_tasks.description: Decide whether to: (a) extend existing enrichment delegate, (b) add another IHostedService, or (c) introduce dedicated middleware. Pick the solution that attaches BOTH request and response headers to the same Activity instance with minimal perf impact.
sub_tasks.output: Short design document linked to the ticket
sub_tasks.validation_criteria: Design doc reviewed & 👍 by at least 1 senior eng and 1 SRE

sub_tasks.name: Implementation – request header enrichment
sub_tasks.description: Inside chosen enrichment hook obtain `HttpContext.Request.Headers["Referer"]`. If the header exists and is not empty, call `activity.SetTag("HTTP_REFERER", refererValue)`.
sub_tasks.validation_criteria: Unit test verifies tag exists for a mocked request with Referer header

sub_tasks.name: Implementation – response redirect enrichment
sub_tasks.description: Augment/insert terminal middleware so that after `await _next(context)` completes, we can read `context.Response.StatusCode` and `context.Response.Headers["Location"]`. When status code is 3xx (301,302,303,307,308) and Location header present, set the tag.
edge_cases: Location header missing – set tag to empty string
Async redirects where response has not yet started – ensure middleware order allows reading header
sub_tasks.validation_criteria: Unit test covers 302 + Location case and 200 case (tag absent)

sub_tasks.name: Static code analysis & security review
sub_tasks.description: Run `dotnet format`, `dotnet build -warnaserror`, and company security linter to ensure no sensitive data leakage beyond header contents already logged elsewhere.
sub_tasks.validation_criteria: No new critical or high security warnings

sub_tasks.name: Performance sanity test
sub_tasks.description: Run k6/locust load test (1k RPS for 5 minutes) comparing baseline vs branch. Acceptable extra latency ≤ 0.5 ms per request and <1 % CPU.
sub_tasks.validation_criteria: Results attached to ticket; thresholds not exceeded

sub_tasks.name: Merge & deploy to Demo
sub_tasks.description: Open PR, obtain 2 approvals, squash-merge. CI/CD pipeline auto-deploys to Demo env.

sub_tasks.name: In-flight verification in Kusto
sub_tasks.description:
Run the expected query: 
```kusto
OtlpSpanEvents
| where Environment == "Demo"
| where url_path == "/clm/Documents/BrowseDocuments.aspx"
| where http_status_code > 200
| project Timestamp,url_path,http_status_code,HTTP_REFERER,HTTP_RESPONSE_REDIRECT_LOCATION
| take 20
```
sub_tasks.validation_criteria: Both attributes populate for at least 10 distinct requests

sub_tasks.name: Rollout to all environments
sub_tasks.description: Progressive promotion: Demo → UAT → Prod with 1-hour observation window each.
sub_tasks.validation_criteria: No error spike, no P95 latency regression >2 %

sub_tasks.name: Post-deployment monitoring & knowledge base update
sub_tasks.description: Add alert in Grafana/Kusto to watch for drop-to-zero of new tags. Update internal wiki page for CLM telemetry conventions.
sub_tasks.validation_criteria: Alert configured; wiki link added to ticket – ticket closed

contextual_hints: Hooking the logic at the correct point in the ASP.NET pipeline so that BOTH the incoming request headers and the final response headers are available on the same Activity instance
Ensuring tags are added only once and are always present for redirect responses, including async/streaming scenarios
Gracefully handling missing or empty headers without throwing, and avoiding null-ref exceptions in hot code paths
